name: 1-benzyloxy-3-iodobenzene
Reason: 1-benzyloxy-3-iodobenzene has a melting point that we can compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene. The introduction of the iodine atom increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the formation of iodine-containing compounds, which have a higher melting point than hydrogen-bonded compounds. The benzyloxy group introduces a rigid structure and additional molecular weight, estimated at approximately +20 °C. The iodine atom also increases the melting point due to the formation of iodine-containing compounds, estimated at approximately +10 °C.
